title: Slider
reference-overview: The Slider gives the user a more visual and tactile approach to filling out numeric form fields.
reference-usage: The slider is an effective way of giving the user the freedom to select a specific number or, by using two sliders, a numeric range. This is best to use if the options for the user’s choices are open ended or span a wide range.
reference-details:
• The slider can be positioned horizontally or vertically depending on the space required.
  • The slider’s numeric values and ranges are completely configurable.
  • The slider’s numeric values are listed alongside the slider as the user moves up or down./li>
  • The slider can be used when the user needs to input a specific numeric range (ie. 20-25).
  • The slider can be used whenever a specific numeric value is required (ie. 42).
reference-mobile:
• The horizontal slider is designed to span the width of mobile devices.
  • Be cautious of headers or titles for the slider and how they will wrap.
  • The default font size for all text will increase for mobile.
reference-technical:
Cross browser compatibility

IE9 doesn't crop background gradients on containers with rounded corners, so we square the corners of every container.
